one_reviews_text: For a shooter it has some high action moments. But zipping around from one stationary point to another is a bit constraining.
Pretty boring. Looks pretty basic too, with a capped resolution and no way of scaling.

review_title: Worst game on the store, by a lot
one_reviews_text: becomes impossible to beat in one particullar scene somewhere in the middle. Sadly by the time you get there you are no longer eligible for a refund.

When it launched, it was great, it gave us some kind of high quality VR shooter at a time without one. Now, it really needs touch support to stay relevant. Just simple aiming and shooting as an option, which shouldn't be too hard.

Damaged Core looks good, runs great, and has a lot of really cool ideas. As one of the earlier VR titles (like The Climb) it also APPEARS to have been designed with Touch in mind... HOWEVER it doesn't actually support Touch. Unfortunately, this is a gamepad-only title with head aiming, and it utterly ruins the game. If Oculus Studios ever updates this with true Touch support, it will be a real showcase title for VR... but as-is, I cannot recommend it at all at any price. Touch is integral to any first-person VR experience, and there is no going back.

I know this doesn't support touch and I should review based on what it is, but I can't, I feel this could really be a touch supported game. Shame it's not as with the current titles out there I can't recommend this for the price.

The game is visually okay and I would give it 4 stars easily if it had Touch support. aiming with your head boring. This game would have been awesome when the DK1 was a thing but now it's just outdated and needlessly so.

review_title: Great use of locomotion, polished game
one_reviews_text: I dont know why people dislike this game, its polished, uses different movement style, and has a descent story.  For anyone thats that says its boring, I don't know which game you're playing.  For those who are complaining about locomotion should have done their research in the first place.  It tells you there's no support for touch controllers and that you transport your AI to different bodies for movement.  Plus, I got this game for $10, worth every penny.  There are few audio bugs at the end level cut scenes, but nothing thats a deal breaker.

the game is good
but the problem is the difficulty.
In defense, they never shoot at you
but only to the objective and you lose immediately without being able to do anything

review_title: Not very fun, gets boring quick
one_reviews_text: This doesn't bring anything new to the table except an excuse to keep the player standing in place. You just teleport from one body to another, there isn't anything really to experience here, this is a $10 experience at best. Though I would have felt ripped off at $10 to be honest.

The basic idea - taking over machines by teleporting into them, being a kind of virus yourself - is great. The problem is, that I don´t even make the first level (protecting the drop ship). I am used to difficult games but this is beyond me. Why is it so hard to create a smooth learning curve? Only buy it if your frustration resistance is really high and you´re into stressful shooters without a break.

No doubt, this title was designed to showcase VR to an audience of early-adopters. Here is a title released at a time when:

* The locomotion issue/debate was still ongoing (and it still kind of is!)
* The Oculus Touch was not out, nor was it coming out for some time
* The Rift could not deliver a room-scale experience

Thus, here we have a game that is designed around these hurdles and ideosyncracies of early VR. 

Given that you play a rogue A.I., who can hack and take control of various droids and vehicles at will, with the caveat that you can only aim; not move, this nullifies early VR problems one and three: locomotion / movement

Given that all the aiming is done with your head, this nullifies problem number two: lack of tracked controllers. 

The touch controls, don't really add anything to the game, which plays fine with head aiming and the Xbone controllers.

One more item of note: The game is rated 18+, which baffles me. Star Wars is more violent. No F-bombs, no gore, no gratuitious nudity. It's not even PG-13 level violence. Why this is rated 18+ is really beyond me.

You don't say it supports touch if it doesn't support touch. Why are people rating this game good? The gameplay is awful. All you do is infect robots that deny you the ability to move and you shoot stuff with them. This is trash. Who cares if it has good graphics if the game isnt fun.

In my opinion, this was the absolute worst idea for locomotion in a game, ever conceived.  You can't move.  All you can do is turn, shoot, and then blip to another character.  And when you die, you have to start whatever scene you're playing from the beginning.  "Frustrating" doesn't even begin to describe it.  I was using curse words I didn't even know that I knew.

Not sure why there are so many positive reviews. I bought this game and only played for a few minutes until I got bored. Maybe it was a good "early" game but graphics and gameplay wise, this game is already long in the tooth.
No nausea, fast and immersive and good balanced.

review_title: Will not launch says cant connect
one_reviews_text: Will not launch says cant connect to Oculus store, I am able to download other games from the store, my connection is good, even turned my firewall completely off. This game will not run.
review_feedback: Hi Hutton Prime, Damaged Core and several other Rift games were affected by an Oculus issue last night that has since been corrected. You should be able to play now.

one_reviews_text: When I got this game it was currently the best VR game in terms of visuals that I had tried out thus far. The gameplay is pretty solid and it definitly keeps you moving and turning quickly in order to survive. If anything my main complaint is that it doesn't have the option to make use of the Oculus Touch controllers. I think it would greatly improve on the overall immersion feel for when you are in control of a robot that has a gun if you were able to.

I bought this awhile back and, although it looks like a great game, head aiming makes me sick after 5-10 minutes. I keep coming back hoping that Touch aiming is added because I really like the overall vibe of the game. Plese add Touch support!
Not working. I have downloaded it today but i will not work. I have black screen only. My I have money back please or fix the game.

review_title: Use your neck to aim in this shooter
one_reviews_text: But don't, actually.

review_title: The game is so good but...
one_reviews_text: it needs Touch Support
after paying high amounts for little content, this was a real treat

review_title: I dire need of a Touch update
one_reviews_text: This game would be 100% better with touch support. I went back to it in hopes that it was added but no luck.
Dont even want to play this game without touch. It was my favorite game.

it was "ok" before touch released, but I hate aiming by looking, and it just felt clunky as an fps. So I can't hardly play it for more than a few minutes now. 
I'm not likely to ever buy a non-Touch vr fps ever again. 
Sorry Robinson: The Journey...

review_title: good but could have been better
one_reviews_text: This game could have been much better with Touch support. Not a bad game but i am not a huge fan of standing with a gamepad.
The game would be so much better with touch support, other than that good game.

Very good game, however it should get touch support to really shine. Staring at things to shoot at them is just not so great, they can leave the stare in order to jump to a different host, but shooting should be decoupled if touch controllers are present.

Storyline is ok and keeps you entertained but I did find the final levels repetetive and the final bossfight was confusing and boring at the same time.

Pretty decent shooter that reminds me of Halo a bit with a little possession and teleporting mixed in, but everyone else is right.  This is made for Touch.  I won't be "touching" this until it gets that support because the gamepad is just so...console.

Game is stupidly hard right from the outset. Also, disappointingly all the action takes place while you are stood still - making it little more than a fancy version of that old tin can alley shooting game you used to play in 1975 in the local arcade. Good graphics though but I hate the teleporting!

review_title: Would be 5 Stars with touch support
one_reviews_text: How the f*** does this game not have touch support? It would fit perfect! And would be very amazing! Except im having dizzynes after like 20 minutes and wana puke a little, which I don't have in other games even after 10 hours. It's worth it tho

Really engaging and fun game with controller. I found playing it from a spinning computer chair to be one of the best VR experiences I've had. Would like to see touch support but with as much spinning as is necessary to be competitive at this game I would think you would need 3 trackers/room scale tracking to make it work well. This game would be difficult using 2 trackers and touch because of the frequent need to turn completely around. The controller not needing to be tracked and the great head tracking make it effortless.

Great game for ppl withouth oculus touch controllers! 
-Nice graphics
-Good gameplay 
-Fair storyline

Even without Touch support this fabulous take on the shooter makes innovative and excellent use of VR to do something really new, and extremely engaging. Having played easily 2 dozen Rift titles, this one definitely stands out as one of the best, possibly my favorite. Excellent replay value.
really need touch support
Please put touch support
Won't load up with hardware error message showing up. No details or anything on the message. Just unusable vagueness. I would like a refund

This game isn't groundbreaking, however it is a very well made VR FPS with some decent gameplay elements and strategies.

The teleportation mechanic is woven into the story and the gameplay so "locomotion purists" won't have to complain.

The hacking mechanic is not only for locomotion and tactical placement, but it also extends to other parts of the game, one mission has something firing rockets at you - hacking the rockets lets you send them back at the enemy for some satisfying payback.

Really enjoying this so far.

review_title: A Must Have for Sci-Fi FPS Lovers
one_reviews_text:
Okay! When I first saw this and read the 'story' behind what to expect in play, I was a bit skekptical.  However, the graphics really reeled me in, as I am an artist myself. Very top notch!
The whole concept from start to finish was very well thought out and craftily put together. The in-game physics felt realistic and natural. The movement of the characters was fluid. The visual effects were memorable, especially when receiving updates and exiting through the camera.
I especially liked the ability to jump from host to host enabling multiple perspectives of a scene. "Shoot them! Possess them! And, get out before its too late!" Really nice.
My only gripes were that the gameplay was short and there's only one difficulty level, making it quite predictable on subsequent plays.
Other than those two points, I think the game is very well made and enjoyable. Maybe the short gameplay is a plus... to reduce eye-fatigue. This was my first VR/FPS and I'd have no hesitation recommending to anyone.
I'm looking forward to Damaged Core II... or other games like this one.
Happy Customer!!!
Please add it

review_title: My Favourite RIFT Game !! More please
one_reviews_text: This is my Favourite rift games. It's action packed, uses VR well using high and low and all around you acpects. This game does not make you feel sick ! It's hard in places but sick with it and you can get through the levels. Really enjoying this game !!

It's cool and very entertaining at the start, but it feels like there something missing from the story. Superb effects, and great game-mechanics! if you want a cool VR action game, take a look at this one.

With VR being so new, I was expecting a lot of pylogonal figures with laggy game play. This game has depth. The story is immersive and it's just right for where VR is right now. Might want to make some room around you before playing. Definitely a game I'd love to see move forward as VR matures.
a nice arcadey type of game.

The 'teleportation' system is really well done that it feels invisible, they turned a draw back of VR locomotion into a feature of the game. I get why some people might get put off/being very anti teleportation but when it's a feature of a game then its a different story, you don't complain when you teleport in flat games when your some kind of teleporting wizard! The premise of why you can teleport is pretty awesome, being a virus infecting other robots minds. Getting a lot of Matrix being an Agent!


One thing i must stress is this game must be played standing, I don't know why the developer didn't put a pop-up at the beginning recommending it, being able to quickly turn your whole body makes its a lot more believable instead of the gun being attached to your head when your seated.
I really love this one. At first I was sceptical because I don't like teleportation AND gunface, but Damaged Core explains both with story and the game mechanics simply work. Give it a try!

This game innovates where other games stammer. The teleportation system in most games feels like a hard limit of the current state of VR. Here it's skillfully woven into the narrative of the game, and never feels limiting. The game itself isn't anything ground breaking, it's a solid shooter with a decent sci-fi storyline. Nothing you're going to be telling your kids around the campfire, but nothing that's going to make you groan and try to skip cutscenes. The control of your gunsights with your head is very intuitive and works without a hitch. There is one train level towards the end that can be a little rough on the sickness prone, but it's entirely worth it for such a fine example of how well a shooter can be done. Game should be played standing, FYI. A swivel chair would work, but I still reccomend you get off your butt for this one. 5/5 likely the closest thing to a AAA exclusive the Oculus Rift will see before touch comes out, and I can't see touch detracting from this.
Very Good
I like it a lot
